headline: James Bond motors go on display at Beaulieu - in pictures
text: Former Bond girl Britt Ekland sits on the bonnet of the original Aston Martin DB5 at a new exhibition, Bond in Motion, at the National Motor Museum, Beaulieu in the New Forest, Hampshire Photograph: Chris Ison/PA       A Jaguar XKR convertible from Die Another Day Photograph: Christian Sinibaldi for the /Guardian       Visitors walk past a Ford Mustang Mach 1 from the James Bond film Diamonds Are Forever Photograph: Suzanne Plunkett/Reuters       A damaged Aston Martin DBS from the James Bond film Quantum of Solace. Photograph: Suzanne Plunkett/Reuters       British actress Madeline Smith poses for photographers in front of a Rolls-Royce Silver Shadow 2 Photograph: Justin Tallis/AFP/Getty Images       A man photographs the Glastron GT-150 Jump Boat with the BMW 750iL at the Bond in Motion exhibition at the Beaulieu National Motor Museum Photograph: Justin Tallis/AFP/Getty Images       Kenneth Wallis poses for photographers with his invention, Little Nellie, at the opening of a press preview of the Bond in Motion exhibition Photograph: Justin Tallis/AFP/Getty Images       A BMW Z8 from The World Is Not Enough Photograph: Suzanne Plunkett/Reuters       British special effects coordinator Chris Corbould poses for photographers in front of a crashed Aston Martin DBS Photograph: Justin Tallis/AFP/Getty Images
